instructions:
In a small saucepan sauté the onion slices in half of the butter and 1/2 tbsp water for about 6 minutes and
set aside. Remove 2 tbsp of the sautéed onion *(to be added to the ground beef)*, and finely chop.
Mix ground beef with the above herbs and spices along with the 2 tbsp of chopped sautéed onion. Make
two ¾ inch thick patties. Melt the remaining butter in a cast iron skillet, and fry the patties over med/low
heat for 3 1/2 minutes on each side.
While the patties are frying, prepare the onion gravy mix with the 7/8 cup of water in the saucepan with
the sautéed onions. Serve with the beef patties.
ingredients: 1 large onion, 1/8 inch sliced and quartered
name: Salisbury Steak Ii
creator: Reader's Digest
